Package com.telenav.kivakit.microservice.internal.protocols.rest.plugins.jetty.cycle

Class JettyRestResponse

java.lang.Object
com.telenav.kivakit.core.messaging.broadcasters.Multicaster
com.telenav.kivakit.core.messaging.repeaters.BaseRepeater
com.telenav.kivakit.component.BaseComponent
com.telenav.kivakit.microservice.internal.protocols.rest.plugins.jetty.cycle.JettyRestResponse
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.telenav.kivakit.component.Component, com.telenav.kivakit.core.messaging.Broadcaster, com.telenav.kivakit.core.messaging.Listener, com.telenav.kivakit.core.messaging.MessageTransceiver, com.telenav.kivakit.core.messaging.Repeater, com.telenav.kivakit.core.messaging.Transceiver, com.telenav.kivakit.core.registry.RegistryTrait, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.messaging.Receiver, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.messaging.Transmitter, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.naming.Nameable, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.naming.NamedObject, Restful, RestProblemReportingTrait, RestResponse
public final class JettyRestResponse extends com.telenav.kivakit.component.BaseComponent implements RestResponse
Not public API

Microservice HTTP response abstraction.

This response object contains an HttpServletResponse and belongs to a JettyRestRequestCycle. Errors can be reported to the response with:

  • problem(HttpStatus, String, Object...)
  • problem(HttpStatus, Throwable, String, Object...)
where the first parameter of each method is an HTTP status code.

The writeResponse(MicroservletResponse) method validates the given MicroservletResponse object before serializing it to JSON format using the JettyRestRequestCycle.gson() object obtained from the RestService. It then writes the JSON string to the HttpServletResponse.

Author:
jonathanl (shibo)

      Specified by:
      toJson in interface Restful

      response - The response object to be serialized
      Returns:
      The object serialized into JSON format, using the application GsonFactory. This behavior can be overridden by implementing GsonFactorySource to provide a custom GsonFactory for a given response object.

    • writeResponse

      public void writeResponse(MicroservletResponse response)
      Writes the given response object to the servlet output stream in JSON format. If the request is invalid, or the response is null or invalid, a MicroservletErrorResponse is sent with the captured error messages.
      Specified by:
      writeResponse in interface RestResponse
      Parameters:
      response - The response to write to the HTTP output stream
